key_facts: Only 87 Bewick’s swans returned to Slimbridge this year.
No cygnets were among the returning Bewick’s swans.
WWT has recorded an 86% decline in Bewick’s swans at Slimbridge over 50 years.
Climate change is reducing Bewick’s swan migration to the UK.
Warmer winters in Europe cause swans to stop migration earlier.
Swans are now wintering in Denmark and the Netherlands.
Bewick’s swans face lead poisoning during migration.
Illegal shooting also threatens migrating Bewick’s swans.
WWT urges the UK government to ban lead ammunition.
WWT calls for more wetlands to support migratory birds.
Wetlands are needed to help counteract climate change.
